section.heading: Stops and inspection.
section.text: To determine compliance with this chapter and its implementing regulations, a police officer may stop the driver of a motor vehicle and enter upon the premises of a motor carrier that is regulated pursuant to this chapter and inspect any of the following:

para.text: All equipment, parts, and accessories, including carrier maintenance, certification, and safety records;
All driver records, including driver’s license, permits, hours of service records, certificate of physical examination, and training records;
All manifests, including bills of lading or other shipping documents; and
All cargo and cargo areas, including the removal of cargo seals when necessary to conduct a safety inspection.

annoGroup.heading: History
annoGroup.annotation: as added Oct. 1, 1992, D.C. Law 9-173, § 3(b), 39 DCR 5834
